part1.title: Introduction and General Questions
part1.description: The examiner will introduce themselves and ask you to introduce yourself. Then they'll ask general questions about familiar topics.

introduction.examiner_intro: Good morning/afternoon. My name is [Examiner Name]. Can you tell me your full name please?
follow_up_questions: Can I see your identification please?
Where are you from?
Do you work or are you a student?

questions: Do you live in a house or an apartment?
Can you describe your home?
What do you like most about your home?
What would you like to change about your home?
What do you do for work?
Do you enjoy your job? Why?
What are your responsibilities at work?
Do you think you'll continue doing this job in the future?
Where is your hometown?
What do you like about your hometown?
Has your hometown changed much over the years?
Would you recommend your hometown to tourists?

part2.title: Cue Card (Individual Long Turn)
part2.description: You will be given a task card with a topic. You have 1 minute to prepare and then speak for 1-2 minutes.

topics.title: Describe a person you admire
topics.cue_card:
Describe a person you admire.

You should say:
• Who this person is
• How you know them
• What they have achieved
• And explain why you admire them
follow_up_questions: Do you think this person is a good role model?
What qualities make someone admirable?
Do you think young people today have good role models?
How important is it to have someone to look up to?
What can we learn from people we admire?
Do you think celebrities make good role models?
How has this person influenced your life?

topics.title: Describe a memorable trip you took
topics.cue_card:
Describe a memorable trip you took.

You should say:
• Where you went
• When you went there
• Who you went with
• And explain why this trip was memorable
follow_up_questions: Do you prefer traveling alone or with others?
What makes a trip memorable?
How has traveling changed in recent years?
What are the benefits of traveling?
Do you think people travel too much nowadays?
How important is it to experience different cultures?
What advice would you give to first-time travelers?

topics.title: Describe a skill you learned recently
topics.cue_card:
Describe a skill you learned recently.

You should say:
• What the skill is
• How you learned it
• Why you decided to learn it
• And explain how this skill has helped you
follow_up_questions: What skills are most important in today's world?
How do you think people will learn skills in the future?
Is it better to learn skills online or in person?
What motivates people to learn new skills?
Should schools teach more practical skills?
How important is continuous learning in modern life?
What challenges do people face when learning new skills?

topics.title: Describe an environmental problem in your area
topics.cue_card:
Describe an environmental problem in your area.

You should say:
• What the problem is
• How long it has existed
• What causes this problem
• And explain what could be done to solve it
follow_up_questions: What are the most serious environmental problems today?
How can individuals help protect the environment?
Should governments do more about environmental problems?
Do you think people are becoming more environmentally conscious?
How might environmental problems affect future generations?
What role should businesses play in environmental protection?
Is it possible to balance economic growth with environmental protection?

topics.title: Describe a book you really enjoyed reading
topics.cue_card:
Describe a book you really enjoyed reading.

You should say:
• What the book was about
• When you read it
• Why you decided to read it
• And explain why you enjoyed it so much
follow_up_questions: Do you think reading books is still important today?
How has technology changed the way people read?
What types of books are popular in your country?
Should children be encouraged to read more?
Do you prefer physical books or e-books?
How do books compare to movies as entertainment?
What makes a book memorable?

topics.title: Describe a traditional festival in your country
topics.cue_card:
Describe a traditional festival in your country.

You should say:
• What the festival is
• When it takes place
• How people celebrate it
• And explain why this festival is important
follow_up_questions: How important are traditional festivals in modern society?
Do you think traditional festivals are changing?
Should governments support traditional festivals?
How do festivals bring communities together?
Are international festivals becoming more popular than traditional ones?
What can festivals teach us about culture?
How might festivals evolve in the future?

part3.title: Discussion (Two-way Discussion)
part3.description: The examiner will ask more abstract questions related to the Part 2 topic, encouraging detailed discussion and opinion sharing.

questions: What qualities do you think make someone a good leader?
How has the concept of heroism changed in modern times?
Do you think social media influences who young people admire?
Should famous people have a responsibility to be good role models?
How important is it for children to have heroes to look up to?
What's the difference between admiring someone and being inspired by them?
Do you think people today are more individualistic than in the past?
How has tourism affected traditional cultures around the world?
Do you think virtual reality could replace actual travel in the future?
What are the environmental implications of mass tourism?
How important is it to preserve local cultures in tourist destinations?
Do you think traveling makes people more tolerant and understanding?
What responsibilities do tourists have when visiting other countries?
How might climate change affect the tourism industry?
Do you think artificial intelligence will change how we learn?
How important is practical experience compared to theoretical knowledge?
Should education systems focus more on creativity or technical skills?
What role should employers play in training their workers?
Do you think people are becoming too dependent on technology?
How might the job market change in the next 20 years?
Is it realistic to expect people to keep learning throughout their careers?
Do you think individual actions can really make a difference to global problems?
How can we balance economic development with environmental protection?
What role should international cooperation play in solving environmental issues?
Do you think future generations will judge us harshly for our environmental impact?
How effective are government policies in changing people's behavior?
Should environmental education be mandatory in schools?
What technological solutions might help solve environmental problems?
How has digital technology changed the publishing industry?
Do you think people's attention spans are getting shorter?
Should schools still require students to read classic literature?
How important is reading for developing critical thinking skills?
Do you think audiobooks and e-books are as beneficial as physical books?
How might storytelling evolve in the digital age?
What impact does reading have on society as a whole?
How can societies maintain their traditions while embracing modernization?
Do you think globalization is making cultures more similar?
What's the difference between preserving culture and being stuck in the past?
How important is it for immigrants to maintain their cultural traditions?
Should governments fund cultural preservation programs?
How do festivals and celebrations contribute to national identity?
Do you think traditional cultures are under threat in the modern world?

bands.9: Speaks fluently with only very occasional repetition or self-correction
bands.7: Speaks at length without noticeable effort with some hesitation
bands.5: Usually maintains flow of speech but hesitation may indicate uncertainty
bands.3: Speaks with long pauses and limited ability to link ideas

bands.9: Uses vocabulary with full flexibility and precise usage
bands.7: Uses vocabulary resource flexibly with some inappropriate choices
bands.5: Manages to talk about familiar topics but limited flexibility
bands.3: Uses simple vocabulary with frequent repetition

bands.9: Uses wide range of structures with full flexibility and accuracy
bands.7: Uses range of complex structures with good flexibility
bands.5: Shows limited range with frequent errors in complex structures
bands.3: Attempts basic sentence forms with frequent errors

bands.9: Uses wide range of pronunciation features with precision
bands.7: Shows all positive features with occasional lapses
bands.5: Shows some effective use of features but not sustained
bands.3: Shows some effective use of features but limited range
